definitions.definition: not consistent or having a fixed pattern; liable to change.
examples: the quality of hospital food is highly variable
synonyms: unreliable; informalup and down "the weather on the shoreline is known for being variable"

definitions.definition: (of a wind) tending to change direction.
examples: changeable, changing, varying, shifting, fluctuating, irregular, inconstant, inconsistent, fluid, unsteady, unstable, unsettled, fitful, mutable, protean, wavering, vacillating, capricious, fickle, volatile, unpredictable, mercurial, unreliable; up and down the weather on the shoreline is known for being variable

definitions.definition: (of a quantity) able to assume different numerical values.
(of a species) liable to deviate from the typical color or form, or to occur in different colors or forms.
able to be changed or adapted.
(of a gear) designed to give varying ratios or speeds.
an element, feature, or factor that is liable to vary or change.
examples: there are too many variables involved to make any meaningful predictions
synonyms: condition "there are other variables to consider"

definitions.definition: a quantity that during a calculation is assumed to vary or be capable of varying in value.
a data item that may take on more than one value during the runtime of a program.
the region of light, variable winds to the north of the northeast trade winds or (in the southern hemisphere) between the southeast trade winds and the westerlies.
